docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text: A module to help automate the cleanup of old log files and temp files on your systems.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The Cleaners do the dirty work in your servers for you. We take care of temp files, IIS logs, Exchange Server logs, and more!

docs.title: Why
docs.text:
• For all those hours spent manually clearing old IIS logs, Exchange logs, and temp files when a server disk gets low on space.
  • For those teammates who get woken up at night while on call because a disk hit 90% full.
  • For the fun of writing something useful in PowerShell that will hopefully make somebody's day easier!

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
PowerShell or Windows PowerShell 5.1

There are no other strict dependencies, but the following can make things a little easier:

  • IIS: WebManagement Module
  • Exchange: Exchange Management Tools

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
# How to install TheCleaners
Install-Module -Name TheCleaners -AllowPrerelease

docs.title: Example1
docs.text:
# See what jobs TheCleaners can do for you.
Start-Cleaning

These docs can also be found at TheCleaners.ReadTheDocs.io/.

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Clean old temp files from user profiles.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
Clear-CurrentUserTemp [[-Days] <Int16>] [[-TimeOut] <Int16>] [-WhatIf]
 [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Remove temp files older than a given number of days from the user's local temp folder.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text: Clear-CurrentUserTemp -Days 30

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text: Clean-CurrentUserTemp -Days 21 -TimeOut 30

docs.title: -Days
docs.text:
Remove temp files that are $Days days old or older. The default is 30.

Type: Int16
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 1
Default value: 30
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -TimeOut
docs.text:
A time limit (seconds) for the looping operation that removes empty directories. The default is 30.

Type: Int16
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 2
Default value: 30
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -WhatIf
docs.text:
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases: wi

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Confirm
docs.text:
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases: cf

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: CommonParameters
docs.text: This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutBuffer, -OutVariable, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, -WarningVariable, and -ProgressAction. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Clean out old Exchange Server logs.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
Clear-OldExchangeLog [[-Days] <Int32>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Remove any Exchange logs that are older than a specified date.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Clear-OldExchangeLog -Days 60

This will remove all Exchange logs older than 60 days.

docs.title: -Days
docs.text:
The number of days to keep logs for. Any logs older than this will be removed.

Type: Int32
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 1
Default value: 60
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -WhatIf
docs.text:
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases: wi

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Confirm
docs.text:
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases: cf

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: CommonParameters
docs.text: This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutBuffer, -OutVariable, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, -WarningVariable, and -ProgressAction. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: A script to clean out old IIS log files.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text: Clear-OldIISLog [[-Days] <Int16>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: This script will clean out IIS log files older than x days.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Clear-OldIISLogFile -Days 60

Removes all IIS log files that are older than 60 days.

docs.title: -Days
docs.text:
The number of days to keep log files. The default is 30 days.

Type: Int16
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 1
Default value: 60
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: CommonParameters
docs.text: This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutBuffer, -OutVariable, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, -WarningVariable, and -ProgressAction. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

docs.title: NOTES
docs.text:
If the WebAdministration module is available, it will use that to check the specific log file locations for each web site. Otherwise, it checks the assumed default log folder location and the registry for the IIS log file location.

To Do: Add a summary of which blocks were run and possibly a count of log files removed.

 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Clear-WindowsTemp -Days 60

Removes all Windows Temp files that are older than 60 days.

docs.title: -Days
docs.text:
The number of days to keep temp files. The default is 30 days.

Type: Int16

Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 1

Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: A script to find old, unused user profiles in Windows.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text: Get-StaleUserProfile [[-Days] <Int16>] [-ShowSummary] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: This script finds old, unused profiles in Windows and helps you remove them. It should exclude special accounts and system profiles.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
$StaleUserProfile = Get-StaleUserProfile -ShowSummary

Gets stale user profiles into the StaleUserProfiles variable while also showing a summary.

docs.title: -Days
docs.text:
Number of days to consider a profile stale. The default is 90.

Type: Int16
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 1
Default value: 90
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -ShowSummary
docs.text:
Show a summary of the stale profiles found.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: CommonParameters
docs.text: This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutBuffer, -OutVariable, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, -WarningVariable, and -ProgressAction. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

docs.title: NOTES
docs.text: Partially inspired by http://woshub.com/delete-old-user-profiles-gpo-powershell/

docs.title: SYNOPSIS

docs.title: DESCRIPTION

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1

Start-Cleaning

View the menu of services that TheCleaners provide.
